intro: Coccoloba guaranitica var. opaca, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Brazilian shield vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in shaded, humid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a houseplant or in shaded garden settings.
